14  Comment out the following line if your compiler supports the (non-standard)
15  asinh, acosh and atanh functions and you want them to be supported. If

21 /*
22  Uncomment the following line to disable the eval() function if it could
23  be too dangerous in the target application.
24  Note that even though the maximum recursion level of eval() is limited,
25  it is still possible to write functions using it which take enormous
26  amounts of time to evaluate even though the maximum recursion is never
27  reached. This may be undesirable in some applications.
28  */
29 //#define DISABLE_EVAL

32 /*
33  Maximum recursion level for eval() calls:
34  */
35 #define EVAL_MAX_REC_LEVEL 1000

38 /*
39  Comment out the following lines out if you are not going to use the
40  optimizer and want a slightly smaller library. The Optimize() method
41  can still be called, but it will not do anything.
42  If you are unsure, just leave it. It won't slow down the other parts of
43  the library.
44  */
45 #ifndef NO_SUPPORT_OPTIMIZER
46 #define SUPPORT_OPTIMIZER

50 /*
51  Epsilon value used with the comparison operators (must be non-negative):
52  (Comment it out if you don't want to use epsilon in comparisons. Might
53  lead to marginally faster evaluation of the comparison operators, but
54  can introduce inaccuracies in comparisons.)
55  */
56 #define FP_EPSILON 1e-14
